alert.note: Alert for Jerome; Twin Falls (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 10 at 12:30PM MST until March 10 at 12:45PM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM MST FOR SOUTHERN TWIN FALLS AND SOUTHEASTERN JEROME COUNTIES... At 1227 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Declo to Norton Bay, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * Expect hazardous driving conditions on US Highway 93 and Interstate 84. Locations impacted include... Kimberly, Hansen, Hazelton, Eden, Rogerson, Hollister, Murtaugh, Rock Creek, Cedar Creek Reservoir, Timber Butte, Salmon Falls Dam, Norton Bay, Magic Valley Regional Airport, China Mountain, Winter Spring, Salmon Falls Reservoir and Milner Dam. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
